physical_appearance: This is an Olympus 35mm automatic camera. It has a black and silver body. It has a viewer on the right side, with a rotational camera lens in front. The lens cover is black and has the brand name 'Olympus' inscribed on it. The camera model 'Olympus Trip 35' is inscribed on the top left of the camera. There is a strap attached to the back.
sgcool_label_text:
The Olympus Trip 35 was advertised in Singapore in 1970 as the only 35mm automatic camera. Marketed features included simplified focusing and fully automatic exposures. 

Before the advent of the portable camera in the late 19th century, the taking of photographs was limited to the studio. However portable cameras remained affordable only to the rich until the first decades of the 20th century.
